pull.title: Exempt unspendable transaction outputs from dust checks
pull.body:
Since unspendable outputs can't be spent, there is no threshold at which it would be uneconomic to spend them.

This primarily targets transaction outputs with `OP_RETURN`, and allows funding of data-only transactions with `"fundrawtransaction"`.

issue.title: Add OP_RETURN support in createrawtransaction RPC call, add tests.
issue.body:
This change adds support for specifying OP_RETURN transaction output in `createrawtransaction` RPC call and automatic tests of this functionality to the testsuite.

Usage:
- generate the data you want to put in the OP_RETURN output:

```
$ echo -n "This OP_RETURN transaction output was created by modified createrawtransaction." | xxd -p -c 200
54686973204f505f52455455524e207472616e73616374696f6e206f7574707574207761732063726561746564206279206d6f646966696564206372656174657261777472616e73616374696f6e2e
$
```
- call `createrawtransaction` with it:

```
$ bitcoin-cli -testnet createrawtransaction "[{\"txid\":\"f7640e528c4ecbcf437adc22e1a02634aefcd286b0affc8a0edde34dcfaef60b\",\"vout\":1}]" "{\"data\":\"54686973204f505f52455455524e207472616e73616374696f6e206f7574707574207761732063726561746564206279206d6f646966696564206372656174657261777472616e73616374696f6e2e\", \"msj42CCGruhRsFrGATiUuh25dtxYtnpbTx\": 1.89999 }"

$
```

The resulting transaction can be seen here: https://www.blocktrail.com/tBTC/tx/519cb9ac3541a2589c909750b7749048ed52df3e8345bb22510c76d14145cca6

~~This modification follows the current rules, i.e.:
1. only one OP_RETURN transaction output in the transaction
2. no more than 80 bytes of data~~

As OP_RETURN outputs are not spendable and can be pruned from UTXO sets, we should encourage its usage. This PR adds this possibility to more Bitcoin Core users.

TODO/need help: rewrite `createrawtransaction` help. I only did a minimal modification of its help text.

This primarily targets transaction outputs with `OP_RETURN`.

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: S-waiting-on-review
labels.description: Status: Awaiting review from the assignee but also interested parties.

issue.title: No dust
issue.body:
The concept of "dust" is useless. Remove it, allowing any nonnegative output value. This simplifies tx creation logic (either in zcashd or third-party code) since dust outputs need not be avoided.

Note that in upstream Bitcoin, unspendable outputs are not considered dust anyway (since https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6444), and there is no reason to prohibit low-valued outputs if you're not going to prohibit unspendable outputs.

labels.name: C-simplification
labels.description: Category: Changes that simplify the protocol specification or consensus rules.

labels.name: D-bitcoin-divergence
labels.description: Design issue: Divergence from Bitcoin (upstream code and/or architecture).

issue.title: Add fundrawtransaction
issue.body:
Adds fundrawtransaction RPC call. Includes the following from Bitcoin Core:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6088 - fundrawtransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6417 - [QA] fix possible reorg issue in (fund)rawtransaction(s).py RPC test
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6444 - Exempt unspendable transaction outputs from dust checks
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6415 - Implement watchonly support in fundrawtransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6828 - [rpc-tests] fundrawtransaction: Update fee after minRelayTxFee increase
commit bebe58 from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7296
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7506 - Use CCoinControl selection in CWallet::FundTransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7518 - Add multiple options to fundrawtransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7967 - [RPC] add feerate option to fundrawtransaction

Includes the updates up until their test framework supported python3. There are more changes that should be ported over after this.

issue.title: [Wallet][RPC] FundTransaction - fundrawtransaction
issue.body:
based on top of
- [x] #1662 

This introduces a new wallet function, `CWallet::FundTransaction()` (and exposes it via RPC with `fundrawtransaction`), to fill a tx containing only vouts (or not enough vins to cover the vouts) with unspent coins from the wallet.

`fundrawtransaction` will not modify existing inputs, and will add one change output (if needed) to the outputs. It will not sign the inputs (so can include also watch-only or multi-sig inputs, if enabled).

backported from:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6088
- bitcoin/bitcoin#17219 [`*`]
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6417
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6444
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6415
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6828 
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7296 (only bebe58b748532157958f9055e4517e280684006c)
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7506
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7518
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7967

adapting the tests for the (more recent) framework.

[`*`] Note: this has been included to be able to call `fundrawtransaction` without the need for an unencrypted wallet (for the change address key)
